TypeSignature.Value: public class BaseInputConnection : Java.Lang.Object, Android.Views.InputMethods.IInputConnection, IDisposable, Java.Interop.IJavaPeerable

.class public auto ansi beforefieldinit BaseInputConnection extends Java.Lang.Object implements class Android.Runtime.IJavaObject, class Android.Views.InputMethods.IInputConnection, class Java.Interop.IJavaPeerable, class System.IDisposable
type BaseInputConnection = class inherit Object interface IInputConnection interface IJavaObject interface IDisposable interface IJavaPeerable

Docs.summary: Base class for implementors of the InputConnection interface, taking care of most of the common behavior for providing a connection to an Editable.

remarks.para: Base class for implementors of the InputConnection interface, taking care of most of the common behavior for providing a connection to an Editable. Implementors of this class will want to be sure to implement #getEditable to provide access to their own editable object, and to refer to the documentation in InputConnection.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool CommitText (Java.Lang.ICharSequence? text, int newCursorPosition);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool CommitText(class Java.Lang.ICharSequence text, int32 newCursorPosition) cil managed
abstract member CommitText : Java.Lang.ICharSequence * int -> bool override this.CommitText : Java.Lang.ICharSequence * int -> bool

Docs.param: The text to commit. This may include styles.

The new cursor position around the text, in Java characters. If > 0, this is relative to the end of the text - 1; if <= 0, this is relative to the start of the text. So a value of 1 will always advance the cursor to the position after the full text being inserted. Note that this means you can't position the cursor within the text, because the editor can make modifications to the text you are providing so it is not possible to correctly specify locations there.
Docs.summary: Default implementation replaces any existing composing text with the given text.

remarks.para: Default implementation replaces any existing composing text with the given text. In addition, only if fallback mode, a key event is sent for the new text and the current editable buffer cleared.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool DeleteSurroundingText (int beforeLength, int afterLength);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool DeleteSurroundingText(int32 beforeLength, int32 afterLength) cil managed
abstract member DeleteSurroundingText : int * int -> bool override this.DeleteSurroundingText : int * int -> bool

Docs.param: The number of characters before the cursor to be deleted, in code unit. If this is greater than the number of existing characters between the beginning of the text and the cursor, then this method does not fail but deletes all the characters in that range.

The number of characters after the cursor to be deleted, in code unit. If this is greater than the number of existing characters between the cursor and the end of the text, then this method does not fail but deletes all the characters in that range.
Docs.summary: The default implementation performs the deletion around the current selection position of the editable text.
Docs.returns: true when selected text is deleted, false when either the selection is invalid or not yet attached (i.e. selection start or end is -1), or the editable text is null.

remarks.para: The default implementation performs the deletion around the current selection position of the editable text.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool SetComposingText (Java.Lang.ICharSequence? text, int newCursorPosition);

abstract member SetComposingText : Java.Lang.ICharSequence * int -> bool override this.SetComposingText : Java.Lang.ICharSequence * int -> bool

Docs.param: The composing text with styles if necessary. If no style object attached to the text, the default style for composing text is used. See for how to attach style object to the text. and are two implementations of the interface .

The new cursor position around the text. If > 0, this is relative to the end of the text - 1; if <= 0, this is relative to the start of the text. So a value of 1 will always advance you to the position after the full text being inserted. Note that this means you can't position the cursor within the text, because the editor can make modifications to the text you are providing so it is not possible to correctly specify locations there.
Docs.summary: The default implementation places the given text into the editable, replacing any existing composing text.

remarks.para: The default implementation places the given text into the editable, replacing any existing composing text. The new text is marked as in a composing state with the composing style.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.
